text:
As you know, when tomcat compiles the jsp to create the corresponding servlet 
(java class), it uses the whole path and name of the jsp to name the resulting 
class. That means that for a page like this:
   webapps\mysite\folder1\folder2\page.jsp
the resulting java file will be:
   localhost_8080%2Fmysite\folder1\folder2\page_jsp.java or similar.

Because I have a pretty deep hierarchy, I reached the maximum number of 
characters for a name in WindowsNT which prevents my servlets from being 
generated.

I get the following message:
   Unable to compile class for page: Can't write: ...... where "...." statnds 
for the long name that has more characters than windows can hold.

Is there a workarround for this.
I can't really shorten the depth of my web site hierarchy because of it's 
complexity. I'm using Windows only as my developing platform and intend to use 
Linux or Solaris for deployment but I guess I'll come up with a similar problem 
there too.

AFAIK, the limits on Unix should be ok. The names on tomcat 3.3 are shorter, 
and probably in a future version of jasper will be more customizable. 

I would sugest you try using a different hierarchy, with shorter names - it's 
dangerous to be so close to the limits :-)
